DataElement.preferredName: Malignant Neoplasm First Metastatic Assessment Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the date on which the first metastasis of the primary malignant neoplasm was assessed.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to an assessment of a first metastasis of the primary malignant neoplasm

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.:Having determined the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.
